page.title: 16Mrs.Kirby of Oakley
page.content: Mrs. Kirby has lived at "Longcroft" in Pardown for 31 years and has served as a{Governor}of the local primary school for 28 years. She has watched the village grow and played an active part in creating the present village community. She has served on local councils,runs the{Luncheon Club,}heads the management of{East Oakley Village {Hall}and plays a major role in the organisation of{Community Care}in the village. She remembers the days when the train stopped by the cricket field to allow visiting teams to alight. A parchment document of 1836 describes a change of ownership of{"Longcroft"} and its neighbour for Â£38 and states that the four tenements should be used as poor houses for people from Wootton St. Lawrence. Until recently Mrs.Kirby paid a peppercorn rent but this has ceased, being too costly to collect.
